Class LevelTwo

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Levels
              • LevelTwo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LevelTwo
extends Levels
    Version Information:

    Author Esther Yoo, Samantha Unger Version # 1 Date 05.27.16 Time Spent 2 hours

    Version:
    1.1 05.27.16 The LevelTwo class is a Level (JPanel) that contains all the setup for the third level of the game. It can be accessed by the user by going to menu, clicking on "Play", and choosing the "Medium" level.
    Author:
    Esther Yoo, Samantha Unger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelTwo

        public LevelTwo(int x,
                int y)
        The class constructor contains all the setup required for Level 2. Assigns appropriate values for Level 2 to variables inherited from Levels

        The volume is adjusted and the background music is started.

        Next, GameTimer is instantiated and the timer is started.

        In the for-loop, each element in the array, letters, is assigned a character from the chosen word.

        Then, in the next for-loop, the starting coordinates of the bubbles, their speed, and their angles are all determined randomly.

        The audio clip that plays the letter corresponding to the current letter is started.

        Lastly, startup() is called, which checks whether the user's input is correct or incorrect, and outputs the results accordingly.

        Parameters:
        x - int that stores the screen width
        y - int that stores the screen height
